summary: Hytale shares statement on preorders, 7 year anniversary
mainText:
'Today is the 7 year anniversary of the Hytale Announcement Trailer.

Although this is yet another milestone on that journey, this one is a bit unprecedented as it will be the first time Hytale is going to be directly funded by the community.

On that note, weâ€™d like to remind everyone again that if you are not comfortable pre-purchasing Hytale in its Early Access state - please donâ€™t.

As 
@Simon_Hypixel
 has mentioned - please support us only if you believe in the long-term plan to make Hytale a great game that stands on its own.

Whether you pre-purchase or you are choosing to wait - we want to sincerely thank everyone who has supported us throughout this crazy journey. We hope to make you all proud.

- The Hytale Team'

summary: DevSlashNull, re: email issues
mainText: 'Unfortunately when we start sending out tons of emails from a domain that has never email sent theres going to be some issues. We're working with providers like Gmail to try and resolve, some folks are getting them instantly, some delayed and some extremely delayed, but the issue is out of our control atm sadly. We will update once we have more information but for the time being we recommend making an account with a different email provider if possible even though we know its not ideal.'

summary: Simon, re: user doubting his passion/motivations
mainText:
'Do you realize I wasn't 100% in control back then? I did a few tweets/posts about it in the past, but clearly, there were signs on the road in different directions in 2019, and we needed money to keep going. I cannot tell the whole story, as you might understand. I did what was best for the game back then; I left and walked away from much bigger financial exit options to make sure the team was taken care of.

Also, bought back at minimum value? HAHA, I wish. I hope the numbers will become public someday so you can see the truth. Did you see the post where they said they had multiple offers for Hytale? I had to fight for it, and I did. I gambled my entire future on it. Given the game's low price, I don't see any return on investment for a couple of years. I do not get a salary. I would have been better off to keep my retirement funds in the S&P500 at that point! 

I also have to sacrifice time with my family and kids to make this happen. For the past 3 months, I haven't taken a single day off. There are days when I see my kids for 10 minutes max.

Why do I even do this? I was already retired and living a good life, so why bother buying this game and trying to fix it? Do you ever think that maybe, just maybe, instead of buying a yacht, I could buy a game that I'm passionate about? Also, why the fuck would I buy a yacht if I have motion sickness on boats? ðŸ˜…'

summary: Simon, re: pre-orders, future plans
mainText:
'Once again, please don't pre-purchase or buy the game if you're not comfortable with early access! 

Support us only if you believe in the long-term plan to make Hytale a great game of its own; we are not trying to be like any other game out there, we are making Hytale.

The future of Hytale
Some of the things we are planning to do, subject to change of course.

- Add more living world features and interactions
- Add more combat content, dungeons/bosses, and more challenges
- Finish World Gen v2 to restore Orbis
- Support modders along the way, add missing features for them and add modding discovery in-game and allow players to install mods from in-game. 1 click install and auto-install on server joins.
- Support server owners by developing our own minigames and giving them access to assets/code and features, and let them outcompete us.
- Add social features like friends list, guilds, prox voice chat and more. Increase user retention by creating a good, safe space. 
- Complete our adventure mode by introducing quests and other systems that make a great adventure, possibly voice actors, in-game cinematics and more!
- The game is funded as a passion project, and I want to have proper parental controls so that when my kids are playing, I feel comfortable with it.
- Add automation systems at some point and other systems that extend the game's appeal for players who love to tinker. 
- Add accessibility options (including controllers)
- Level up the visuals across the whole game, lighting improvements and much more
- Listen and interact with the community

and much much more.'
